law.catch_line: Application -- Approval and issuance of certificate -- Information to be filed -- Administrative regulations.

text.section: A business entity seeking to obtain a certificate of registration to act as an insurance purchasing outlet shall complete and file with the commissioner of the Kentucky Department of Insurance an application prescribed by the commissioner.
An application shall not be deemed filed until all information necessary to process the application properly has been received by the commissioner.

Within one hundred eighty (180) days of receipt of an application for a certificate of registration, the commissioner shall make a determination concerning the application and provide notice to the applicant. If approved, a certificate of registration, in a form prescribed by the commissioner, shall be provided to the insurance purchasing outlet.
Any information filed by an insurance purchasing outlet pursuant to subsection (4) of this section that changes shall be refiled with the commissioner for approval.
The commissioner may promulgate administrative regulations to establish standards in accordance with subsection (4) of this section.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 1252, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 207, sec. 3, effective July 15, 2002.
